intro: Orestias stelidostachya, commonly known as the Andean water plant, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, rocky habitats, often near streams or lakes in the Andes. Due to its unique adaptations to high-altitude environments, it plays an important role in the ecological balance of these regions.
